creditline: Gift of John R. Van Derlip, E. C. Gale and others
description: Burdett pitcher, ceramics-pottery; Yellow glaze with line of silver lustre around rim, neck, base, and handle. On each side a silver lustre medallion with transfer portrait of Burdett.
inscription:
Inscription

Sir Francis Burdett Bar - M.P.; Committed to the Tower 6 April 1810 by the House of Commons for firmly and disinterestedly asserting the legal rights of the British People.

Inscription on second medallion reads: The determined enemy of corruption and the constitutional friend of his SOVEREIGN.
title: Pitcher
